com.cortxt.app.corelib.Utils

Class QosInfo.NetworkInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cortxt.app.corelib.Utils.QosInfo.NetworkInfo
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    QosInfo.CDMAInfo, QosInfo.GSMInfo, QosInfo.LTEInfo, QosInfo.WCDMAInfo, QosInfo.WIFIInfo
    Enclosing class:
    QosInfo

    public class QosInfo.NetworkInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    NetworkInfo is meant to be used directly to simplify access to information about the connected network. NetworkInfo is also the base class for all of the main types of data network including LTEInfo, WiFiInfo, etc. The connectedNetwork object is a NetworkInfo object. NetworkInfo provides a signal indicator, quality indicator, and an array of all the cellular identifiers. The signal indicator consists of a label such as 'RSSI' or 'RSRP' to describe the measurement the represents signal strength for the current type of network.

      java.lang.String getIdentifier()
      getIdentifier returns a text description of the Base Station's full Identifier For example a full 3G cell identifier consists of LAN,RNC,CellID and PSC Each derived Network type defines an array of labels, values and doc descriptions to represent all the components to be appended for getIdentifier

    • Method Detail

      • getSignalRating

        public int getSignalRating()
        Easy to understand rating for the signal type for the connected network.
        Returns:
        rating from 0 to 5, equivalent to 'bars' where 5 bars is an excellent signal level

      • getSignalDetails

        public java.lang.String getSignalDetails(boolean withValue,
                                boolean withRating)
        getSignalDetails returns a text description of the signal type for the connected network. the text is composed of the signalLabel and, optionally, the value, rating and units.
        Parameters:
        withValue - to include the dBm value of the signal getSignal () and its units getSignalUnits ()
        withRating - to include the rating of the signal getSignalRating ()
        Returns:
        the full text description

      • getSignalLabel

        public java.lang.String getSignalLabel()
        Get the name of the type of signal for the connected network. The label, units and ranges are defined in the constructor for each derived class.
        Returns:
        the name of the relevent type of signal (RSSI, RSRP etc)

      • getSignalUnits

        public java.lang.String getSignalUnits()
        Get the unit for the type of signal for the connected network.
        Returns:
        the unit for the relevent type of signal (usually dBm)

      • getSignalRangeMin

        public int getSignalRangeMin()
        Get the minimum value of the signal range.
        Returns:
        the minimum signal value (usually -120 dBm)

      • getSignalRangeMax

        public int getSignalRangeMax()
        Get the maximum value of the signal range.
        Returns:
        the maximum signal value (usually -40 dBm)

      • getSignalRangeExcellent

        public int getSignalRangeExcellent()
        Get the value of the signal that gives excellent performance, expected near the tower. Values above excellent are rated as 5 bars. Each derived network type sets its range. RSRP -85 dBm is 'excellent' for LTE.
        Returns:
        the excellent signal value

      • getSignalDoc

        public java.lang.String getSignalDoc()
        Get a short documentation of the relevent type of signal for the network.
        Returns:
        the description document

      • getSignal

        public int getSignal()
        Get the actual value of the signal.
        Returns:
        the signal value (usually -40 to -120)

      • getQuality

        public float getQuality()
        Get the actual value of the noise or quality indicator. Some network types can provide an additional performance indicator. This is usually a measure of noise and is a good indicator or data throughput or voice quality.
        Returns:
        the indicator value

      • getQualityRating

        public int getQualityRating()
        Easy to understand rating for the signal type for the connected network.
        Returns:
        rating from 0 to 5, equivalent to 'bars' where 5 bars is an excellent signal level.

      • getQualityDetails

        public java.lang.String getQualityDetails(boolean withValue,
                                 boolean withRating)
        getQualityDetails returns a text description of the main noise/quality indicator, if available, for the connected network. The text is composed of the qualityLabel and, optionally, the value, rating and units.
        Parameters:
        withValue - to include the value of the quality indicator getQuality () and its units getQualityUnits ()
        withRating - to include the rating of the quality indicator getQualityRating ()
        Returns:

      • getQualityLabel

        public java.lang.String getQualityLabel()
        Get the name of the type of quality/noise indicator the connected network. The label, units and ranges are defined in the constructor for each derived class.
        Returns:
        the name of the indicator for the connected network (Ec/i0, SNR etc)

      • getQualityUnits

        public java.lang.String getQualityUnits()
        Get the unit for the type of quality/noise indicator for the connected network
        Returns:
        the unit for the connected network (may be unitless and return a blank string)

      • getQualityRangeMin

        public int getQualityRangeMin()
        Get the minimum value of the range for the main quality/noise indicator
        Returns:
        the minimum value (usually -30 for Ec/i0 or -10 for SNR)

      • getQualityRangeMax

        Get the maximum value of the range for the main quality/noise indicator
        Returns:
        the maximum signal value (usually -40 dBm)

      • getIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        getIdentifier returns a text description of the Base Station's full Identifier For example a full 3G cell identifier consists of LAN,RNC,CellID and PSC Each derived Network type defines an array of labels, values and doc descriptions to represent all the components to be appended for getIdentifier
        Returns:
        the full text description to indentify the current base station
